intro: Heliohebe lavaudiana, commonly known as the coastal heliohebe, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and hairy stems. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in coastal environments and is adapted to sandy, well-drained soils. Heliohebe lavaudiana is often found in the lower regions of the North Island and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
